meanings.definition: A small Jewish town or village in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: The shtetlach were close-knit communities where everyone knew each other.
meanings.sent2: My grandparents grew up in different shtetlach in Poland.
meanings.sent3: The shtetlach had charming little synagogues with colorful windows.
meanings.sent4: In his stories, the author painted the shtetlach as bustling hubs of tradition.
meanings.sent5: The shtetlach were like hidden gems nestled in the countryside.

meanings.sent1: We visited several shtetlach during our trip to Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the locations of all the shtetlach in the region.
meanings.sent3: The shtetlach on the horizon looked like tiny dots against the sky.
meanings.sent4: The shtetlach in the distance seemed to hold centuries of stories.
meanings.sent5: The shtetlach were like pieces of history scattered across the landscape.
